message_1:
A math teacher wants to analyze the relationship between the scores of three different exams: Exam 1, Exam 2, and Exam 3. The teacher collected the scores of 20 students in the class for each exam, and wants to perform a multivariate analysis to see if there is a relationship between the exam scores. Here are the scores:

| Student | Exam 1 | Exam 2 | Exam 3 |
|---------|--------|--------|--------|
| 1       | 90     | 85     | 87     |
| 2       | 67     | 75     | 62     |
| 3       | 88     | 91     | 90     |
| 4       | 81     | 73     | 85     |
| 5       | 76     | 80     | 88     |
| 6       | 90     | 92     | 89     |
| 7       | 72     | 68     | 70     |
| 8       | 88     | 85     | 81     |
| 9       | 93     | 95     | 94     |
| 10      | 71     | 81     | 69     |
| 11      | 83     | 80     | 85     |
| 12      | 77     | 82     | 80     |
| 13      | 85     | 88     | 87     |
| 14      | 78     | 81     | 75     |
| 15      | 64     | 72     | 60     |
| 16      | 91     | 94     | 93     |
| 17      | 86     | 88     | 85     |
| 18      | 76     | 81     | 79     |
| 19      | 93     | 94     | 95     |
| 20      | 68     | 75     | 70     |

What is the correlation matrix between the scores of Exam 1, Exam 2, and Exam 3?
message_2:
To find the correlation matrix between the scores of Exam 1, Exam 2, and Exam 3, we first need to calculate the correlation coefficients between each pair of exams. The correlation coefficient (r) is a measure of the strength and direction of the linear relationship between two variables. It ranges from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to 1 (perfect positive correlation).

Using the given data, we can calculate the correlation coefficients between Exam 1 and Exam 2 (r12), Exam 1 and Exam 3 (r13), and Exam 2 and Exam 3 (r23). 

After calculating the correlation coefficients, we get:

r12 = 0.875
r13 = 0.879
r23 = 0.936

Now, we can create the correlation matrix:

|       | Exam 1 | Exam 2 | Exam 3 |
|-------|--------|--------|--------|
| Exam 1| 1      | 0.875  | 0.879  |
| Exam 2| 0.875  | 1      | 0.936  |
| Exam 3| 0.879  | 0.936  | 1      |

So, the correlation matrix between the scores of Exam 1, Exam 2, and Exam 3 is:

| 1     | 0.875 | 0.879 |
| 0.875 | 1     | 0.936 |
| 0.879 | 0.936 | 1     |
